title: Read Trump’s Letter to Turkey’s President
text:
THE WHITE HOUSE

WASHINGTON

October 9, 2019

His Excellency Recep Tayyip Erdogan President of the Republic of Turkey Ankara

Dear Mr. President:

Let's work out a good deal! You don't want to be responsible for slaughtering thousands of people, and I don't want to be responsible for destroying the Turkish economy — and I will. I've already given you a little sample with respect to Pastor Brunson.

I have worked hard to solve some of your problems. Don't let the world down. You can make a great deal. General Mazloum is willing to negotiate with you, and he is willing to make concessions that they would never have made in the past. I am confidentially enclosing a copy of his letter to me, just received.

History will look upon you favorably if you get this done the right and humane way. It will look upon you forever as the devil if good things don't happen. Don't be a tough guy. Don't be a fool!

I will call you later.
description: Trump said he’d written the “very powerful” letter to warn the Turkish leader.
